properties.name: ldap.bind.dn
properties.description: The bind DN for LDAP server simple bind requests.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.age.max
properties.description: Specifies the maximum length of time in milliseconds that a connection in this pool may be established before it should be closed and replaced with another connection.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.size.init
properties.description: The number of connections to initially establish when the pool is created.  It must be greater than or equal to zero.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.size.max
properties.description: The maximum number of connections that should be maintained in the pool.  It must be greater than or equal to the initial number of connections, and must not be zero.

properties.name: ldap.server.useSSL
properties.description: Specifies if the LDAP server should use SSL for the connection

properties.name: ldap.serverList
properties.description: Comma or space delimited list of server addresses in host:port format, port default is 636

properties.name: ldap.serverList
properties.description: Comma or space delimited list of server addresses in host:port format, port default is 636

properties.name: list.users.by.role.limit
properties.description: The limit to the number of users allowed to be assigned a role before the v2 list users with role API call will return an error.

properties.name: nast.tenant.prefix
properties.description: The prefix to append to nast tenant ids

properties.name: nast.tenant.prefix
properties.description: The prefix to append to nast tenant ids

properties.name: racker.impersonate.role
properties.description: The group name in EDir to determine whether racker has authorization to impersonate

properties.name: email.host
properties.description: Email host to use when sending emails.

properties.name: email.send.to.only.rackspace.addresses.enabled
properties.description: Flag that restricts outgoing emails to only rackspace.com emails. This will prevent any emails from being sent from staging.

properties.name: multifactor.key.location
properties.description: The location of the legacy encryption keys

properties.name: token.scoped.expirationSeconds
properties.description: Expiration time for Setup-MFA scoped tokens.

properties.name: feature.KeyCzarCrypterLocator.storage
properties.description: Whether to load keys from FILE or LDAP

properties.name: multifactor.key.location
properties.description: When FILE is used for AE key storage, where the keys are located

properties.name: feature.delete.unused.duo.phones
properties.description: Whether or not to delete a Duo phone that is not linked to by any Identity user

properties.name: feature.multifactor.locking.attempts.maximumNumber
properties.description: local multifactor locking maximum number of attempts

properties.name: feature.multifactor.locking.login.failure.ttl.in.seconds
properties.description: How long, in seconds, after which the last invalid MFA logic attempt will be ignored. This affects when an account will be automatically unlocked when using local locking

properties.name: local.multifactor.bypass.num.iterations
properties.description: Number of hashing iterations to perform before storing bypass codes

properties.name: max.otp.device.per.user
properties.description: Maximum number of OTP devices a user can associate with his/her account

properties.name: ae.auto.reload.keys.in.seconds
properties.description: How often to check for AE key changes and reload if found. This is how long after the last time the check was made completes before checking again.

properties.name: ae.node.name.for.signoff
properties.description: The unique name for this API Node. This is used for both signoff on the AE keys loaded into cache by this node, and to record the node making changes

properties.name: feature.ae.auto.reload.keys.enabled
properties.description: Whether or not to periodically check whether a newer version of AE keys exist and automatically reload

properties.name: feature.ae.sync.signoff.enabled
properties.description: Whether or not to keep the signoff object in sync with the loaded AE Key cache

properties.name: email.port
properties.description: Email port to use when sending emails.

properties.description: Default region_id when creating an endpoint

properties.description: Default domain_id when creating a tenant

properties.name: cached.ae.token.cache.concurrency.level
properties.description: The concurrency level of the AE Token cache. Should roughly how many threads will attempt to concurrently update the cache.

properties.name: cached.ae.token.cache.initial.capacity
properties.description: The initial capacity of the AE Token cache. A higher value prevents unnecessary resizing later at the cost of more upfront memory

properties.name: cached.ae.token.cache.max.size
properties.description: The maximum size of the AE Token cache

properties.name: cached.ae.token.cache.record.stats
properties.description: Whether the AE Token cache will record stats.

properties.name: cached.ae.token.ttl.seconds
properties.description: The time an entry will exist in the AE token cache before naturally expiring

properties.description: The max token lifetime for a provisioned federated user token

properties.description: The max age of a saml response for it to be considered valid.

properties.name: feature.federated.issueInstant.max.skew
properties.description: The max skew +/- seconds of a saml response for it to still be considered valid.

properties.name: feature.support.saml.logout
properties.description: Whether or not to support SAML Federation Logout

properties.name: federated.deltaExpiration.seconds
properties.description: Delta time in seconds to be added for federated users deletion eligibility

properties.description: The default max number of users in IDP per domain.

properties.name: feature.federation.deletion.timeout

properties.description: Return email address to use when sending emails to customers. Was added as a static property in version 2.5.0, but was migrated to be a reloadable in this version.

properties.description: (Migrated from static w/ fallback to static if not found in reloadable). Flag that restricts outgoing emails to only rackspace.com emails. This will prevent any emails from being sent from staging.

properties.description: Email username for authentication to email server.

properties.name: feature.return.json.specific.cloud.version
properties.description: Whether or not to return the custom versions.json when GET /cloud is called and json is requested or translate the versions.xml to json

properties.name: feature.reuse.jaxb.context
properties.description: Whether or not to reuse JAXBContext across threads rather than creating new one for each use which causes a memory leak. This feature is only here to revert to existing functinality if required.

properties.name: multifactor.sessionid.lifetime
properties.description: Lifetime, in minutes, of MFA sessionIds. Was added as static prop in 2.2.0, but switched from to reloadable prop in version 3.4.0

properties.description: Number of hours after creation, based on accessTokenExp attribute, that a TRR can be purged

properties.name: purge.trrs.max.delay
properties.description: Maximum time, in ms, caller can specify to delay between deleting token revocations records

properties.name: purge.trrs.max.limit
properties.description: Maximum number of TRRs that will be deleted in the call

properties.name: feeds.dataCenter
properties.description: The data center to use when posting events to atom hopper. This property was introduced as a static property in version 1.0.14.8 and migrated to a reloadable property in version 3.5.0.

properties.name: feeds.dataCenter
properties.description: The data center to use when posting events to atom hopper. This property was introduced as a static property in version 1.0.14.8 and migrated to a reloadable property in version 3.5.0.

properties.name: feeds.region
properties.description: The region to use when posting events to atom hopper. This property was introduced as a static property in version 1.0.14.8 and migrated to a reloadable property in version 3.5.0.

properties.name: feeds.region
properties.description: The region to use when posting events to atom hopper. This property was introduced as a static property in version 1.0.14.8 and migrated to a reloadable property in version 3.5.0.

properties.name: feeds.url
properties.description: The URL to use when posting events to atom hopper. This property was introduced as a static property in version 1.0.14.8 and migrated to a reloadable property in version 3.5.0.

properties.name: feeds.url
properties.description: The URL to use when posting events to atom hopper. This property was introduced as a static property in version 1.0.14.8 and migrated to a reloadable property in version 3.5.0.

properties.name: feature.endpoint.template.disable.name.type
properties.description: Whether or not endpoint template creation is allowed using service name and type.

properties.name: feeds.connection.request.timeout.ms
properties.description: The timeout in milliseconds until a connection is retrieve from the connection pool.

properties.name: feeds.connection.timeout.ms
properties.description: The timeout in milliseconds until a connection is established. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite

properties.name: feeds.max.connections
properties.description: The total http connections allowed by the HttpClient used to post feed events

properties.name: feeds.max.connections.per.route
properties.description: The total http connections allowed by the HttpClient for each route used to post feed events

properties.name: feeds.new.connection.socket.timeout.ms
properties.description: The timeout to establish a new socket for non-blocking I/O operations

properties.name: feeds.on.use.eviction.validate.after.ms
properties.description: After how long of inactivity, in ms, a connection will be checked for validity.

properties.name: feeds.socket.timeout.ms
properties.description: The timeout for waiting for data when sending feed requests - or, put differently, a maximum period inactivity between two consecutive data packets. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite

properties.name: max.ca.directory.page.size
properties.description: The maximum page size allowed to query the directory for. This property should be set to match the maximum query size as configured on the CA directory side. It should also be noted that this property will also impact other services through the API. For example, the API call used for deleting TRRs will limit how many TRRs can be deleted in a single request based upon this configuration.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.allow.concurrent.socketfactory.use
properties.description: Indicates whether to allow a socket factory instance to be used to create multiple sockets concurrently.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.check.connection.age.on.release
properties.description: Specifies whether to check the age of a connection against the configured maximum connection age whenever it is released to the pool.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.create.if.necessary
properties.description: Specifies whether the connection pool should create a new connection if one is requested when there are none available.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.health.check.interval
properties.description: Specifies the length of time in milliseconds between periodic background health checks against the available connections in this pool.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.max.wait.time
properties.description: Specifies the maximum length of time in milliseconds to wait for a connection to become available when trying to obtain a connection from the pool.

properties.name: feature.include.endpoints.based.on.rules
properties.description: When true, endpoints based on rules are included in 'authentication' and 'list endpoints for token'

properties.name: feature.list.support.additional.role.properties
properties.description: When true, additional role attributes are returned.

properties.name: feature.post.idp.feed.events
properties.description: When true, whenever an IDP is created, updated, or deleted an IDP feed event is posted to the Identity feed.

properties.name: identity.provider.policy.max.kilobyte.size
properties.description: Determines the max size in kilobytes for an IDP's policy file.

properties.name: feature.tenant.id.in.auth.response.v10
properties.description: Determines if the X-Tenant-Id header should be populated in v1.0 authenticate calls.

properties.name: feature.tenant.id.in.auth.response.v11
properties.description: Determines if the X-Tenant-Id header should be populated in v1.1 authenticate calls.

properties.name: cache.client.role.by.id.size
properties.description: The max size of the client role by id cache.

properties.name: cache.client.role.by.id.ttl
properties.description: The ttl of entries in the client role by id cache. A ttl of 0 means no cache.

properties.name: domain.default.session.inactivity.timeout
properties.description: Default value for session inactivity timeout assigned to domains.

properties.name: feature.allow.updating.approved.domain.ids.for.idp
properties.description: When true, allow updating approvedDomainIds for Identity provider.

properties.name: feature.force.standard.v2.exceptions.end.user.services
properties.description: Whether to change contract for set of services accessible to user-admin/default users which currently return non-standard v2.0 error objects to now return the standard errors

properties.name: feature.v2.federation.validate.origin.issue.instant
properties.description: When true, v2 federation calls will validate the issueInstant of the origin saml assertions.

properties.name: feeds.allow.connection.keep.alive
properties.description: Specifies whether to enable keep alive for feed connections

properties.name: feeds.connection.keep.alive.ms
properties.description: Specifies the keep alive feed connections duration

properties.name: feeds.daemon.eviction.close.idle.after.ms
properties.description: When the feeds pool is using DAEMON eviction strategy, connections will be removed from the pool if they have been idle for this this many ms. A value <= 0 indicates idle connections will not be removed

properties.name: feeds.daemon.eviction.enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether to enable feeds deamon to evict expired connections from connection pool.

properties.name: feeds.daemon.eviction.frequency.ms
properties.description: When the feeds pool is using DAEMON eviction strategy, how often expired connections are removed from the pool.

properties.name: session.inactivity.timeout.max.duration
properties.description: Session inactivity timeout max duration in ISO 8601 format.

properties.name: session.inactivity.timeout.min.duration
properties.description: Session inactivity timeout min duration in ISO 8601 format.

properties.name: feature.enable.password.policy.services
properties.description: Whether or not domain password policy support is enabled

properties.name: feature.enforce.password.policy.expiration
properties.description: Whether or not to enforce password policy password rule

properties.name: feature.enforce.password.policy.history
properties.description: Whether or not to enforce password policy history

properties.name: feature.infer.default.tenant.type
properties.description: Whether to infer a tenant type for tenants without a tenant type when applying RCN roles

properties.name: feature.maintain.password.history
properties.description: Whether or not to maintain password history. If history enforcement is enabled, this is always true

properties.name: feature.set.default.tenant.type.on.creation
properties.description: Whether to set the default tenant type on the tenant upon creation based on the tenant name prefix.

properties.name: max.tenant.type.size
properties.description: Maximum number of tenantTypes allowed to be created.  Maximum value allowed is 999.

properties.name: password.history.max
properties.description: The maximum number of password history entries Identity will store for a user. Will actually store 1 more than this to include the 'current' password.

properties.name: feature.allow.username.updates
properties.description: Whether to allow a provisioned user's username to be updated.

properties.name: feature.enable.external.user.idp.management
properties.description: Maximum number of explicit IDPs per domain

properties.name: federated.max.identity.provider.per.domain
properties.description: Maximum number of explicit IDPs per domain

properties.name: feature.enable.issued_at.in.response
properties.description: Specify if issued will be included in authenticate, impersonate and validate response.

properties.name: federation.identity.provider.default.policy
properties.description: The default policy used when creating an IDP
properties.value:
---
# NOTE: This example policy MUST be replaced BEFORE federated users can log in.
# Refer to the Identity Federation documentation for more information.
mapping:
  rules:
  - local:
      user:
        domain: "{D}"
        name: "{D}"
        email: "{D}"
        roles: "{D}"
        expire: "{D}"
  version: RAX-1

properties.name: mapping.policy.accept.formats
properties.description: Specify the acceptable media types for mapping policies

properties.name: allow.update.domain.rcn.on.update.domain
properties.description: Whether to allow updating an domain's RCN using the update domain API call.

properties.name: enable.user.groups.for.domains
properties.description: A comma delimited list of domains for which user groups will be allowed

properties.name: enable.user.groups.for.domains
properties.description: A comma delimited list of domains for which user groups will be allowed

properties.name: enable.user.groups.globally
properties.description: Whether or not user groups are supported for all domains for management and considered during effective role calculation

properties.name: user.groups.max.in.domain
properties.description: Maximum number of user groups that can be created per domain

properties.name: feature.should.display.service.catalog.for.suspended.user.impersonate.tokens
properties.description: Whether or not to filter the service catalog for impersonation tokens of suspended users (users that belong to a domain with all domain tenants disabled)

properties.name: feature.enable.global.root.da.creation
properties.description: Limit the creation of root DAs to user-admins.

properties.name: feature.enable.role.hierarchy
properties.description: Whether to enable role hierarchy support.

properties.name: nested.delegation.agreement.role.hierarchy
properties.description: Role assignment hierarchy for nested DAs.
properties.value: {billing:admin=[admin], ticketing:observer=[admin, observer, ticketing:admin], observer=[admin], billing:observer=[admin, observer, billing:admin], ticketing:admin=[admin]}

properties.name: feature.delete.all.tenants.when.tenant.removed.from.domain
properties.description: Whether to delete all tenant roles when tenant is removed from domain.

properties.name: feature.enable.delegation.grant.roles.to.nested.da
properties.description: Whether to delete all tenant roles when tenant is removed from domain.

properties.name: feature.enable.send.new.relic.custom.data
properties.description: Whether or not to push custom attributes to New Relic for each API transaction

properties.name: feature.enable.use.repose.request.id
properties.description: Whether or not to use the value supplied in the X-Request-Id header as the log transaction id. If set to false (or set to true but the header is null or blank), Identity generates a GUUID for the transaction id.

properties.name: new.relic.secured.api.resource.attributes
properties.description: When secure attributes are enabled, a comma delimited list to secure

properties.name: feature.enable.new.relic.sha256.hmac
properties.description: When secure attributes are enabled, whether to use SHA-256 HMAC or fallback to SHA1

properties.name: feature.use.subtree.delete.control.for.subtree.deletion.enabled
properties.description: Whether to use subtree delete control for subtree deletion.

properties.name: feature.enable.ldap.auth.password.lockout.cache
properties.description: Whether or not to cache user pwd lockouts and not attempt to bind to LDAP again until the specified amount of time has elapsed. Initially only lockouts for disabled users are cached.

properties.name: feature.enable.ldap.health.check.connection.for.continued.use
properties.description: Whether to enable health check on valid connection for continued use.

properties.name: feature.enable.ldap.health.check.new.connection
properties.description: Whether to enable health check on new LDAP connection.

properties.name: ldap.auth.password.lockout.cache.size
properties.description: The max size of the user lockout cache.

properties.name: ldap.auth.password.lockout.cache.ttl
properties.description: The ttl of entries in the user lockout cache. A ttl of 0 means no cache.

properties.name: ldap.auth.password.lockout.duration
properties.description: LDAP will lock out a user after a threshold of invalid pwd auth attempts for a configured amount of time. This setting mirrors the LDAP setting in order to provide valid auth messages and to cache that the user is locked out until the specified amount of time has elapsed without hitting LDAP again. This value must match the LDAP configuration setting. If higher than LDAP, then the app will incorrectly think a user is still locked out and not send the bind request to LDAP.

properties.name: ldap.auth.password.lockout.retries
properties.description: LDAP will lock out a user after a threshold of invalid pwd auth attempts for a configured amount of time. This setting is analogous to the LDAP setting 'password-retries' to specify how many attempts a user has until the account is locked. This value must match the LDAP setting for a consistency with LDAP. If higher than LDAP, the app will not log appropriate error messages and the lockout cache will not be used. If lower, the app will consider users locked out while CA doesn't.

properties.name: ldap.server.pool.min.disconnect.interval.time
properties.description: Specifies the minimum length of time in milliseconds that should pass between connections closed because they have been established for longer than the maximum connection age.

properties.name: new.relic.exclude.auth.resource.attributes
properties.description: The custom attributes to exclude from auth api resources (overrides inclusion). '*' means all available

properties.name: new.relic.exclude.private.resource.attributes
properties.description: The custom attributes to exclude from private api resources (overrides inclusion). '*' means all available

properties.name: new.relic.exclude.public.resource.attributes
properties.description: The custom attributes to exclude from public api resources (overrides inclusion). '*' means all available

properties.name: new.relic.include.auth.resource.attributes
properties.description: The custom attributes to push for auth api resources. '*' means all available

properties.name: new.relic.include.private.resource.attributes
properties.description: The custom attributes to push for private api resources. '*' means all available

properties.name: new.relic.include.public.resource.attributes
properties.description: The custom attributes to push for public api resources. '*' means all available

properties.name: racker.groups.cache.ttl

properties.description: The max size of the racker groups cache.

properties.description: The ttl of entries in the racker auth result cache. A ttl of 0 means no cache.

properties.description: The max size of the racker auth result cache.

properties.description: Whether or not to cache racker authentication results.
